paper_abstract: The Randic index R(G) of a graph G is the sum of weights (deg(u) deg(v))(-0.5) over all edges uv of G, where deg( v) denotes the degree of a vertex v. Let r(G) be the radius of G. We prove that for any connected graph G of maximum degree four which is not a path with even number of vertices, R(G) >= r(G). As a consequence, we resolve the conjecture R(G) >= r(G) - 1 given by Fajtlowicz in 1988 for the case when G is a chemical graph.
paper_title: On the Inequality between Radius and Randic Index for Graphs
